definition: snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean

pinyin: A1 la1 si1 jia1 xue3 qiao1 quan3

sentences.english: After that, everybody pelted snowballs at anybody who was riding the sled.
sentences.chinese: 那之後，每個人都對著坐雪橇滑下來的人砸雪球。

sentences.english: The horse knows the way to carry the sleigh.
sentences.chinese: 馬兒拉着雪橇，跑向我們的目的地。

sentences.english: He has a sleigh and reindeers.
Shasta, we took a vote and decided to help you start a dogsled team.
sentences.chinese: 我們投票決定幫你組織一支雪橇隊。

sentences.english: He took sleds and dogs with him.
sentences.chinese: 然後帶上幾隻雪橇犬，便拉着他出發了。

sentences.english: Millstones had been cut and laboriously sledged down the rough mountainsides .
sentences.chinese: 石磨被琢好，然後費力用雪橇運下那崎嶇不平的山坡。

sentences.english: Pull a sled into the mud, so we worse calamity.
sentences.chinese: 把雪橇拖進泥塘裏，害得我們糟了殃。

sentences.english: We got home and went sledding on the small hill in our back yard.
sentences.chinese: 我們回到家裏，然後去後院的小山上滑雪橇。

sentences.english: Ten years ago, smooth plastic sleds became popular;
sentences.chinese: 十年前，塑料雪橇開始流行。

sentences.english: If we're going to be a dogsled team.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們要組建一支雪橇隊。

sentences.english: In winter, I built snow tunnels and went sledding.
sentences.chinese: 冬天的時候，我挖完冰道又去滑雪橇。

sentences.english: Alpine skiing and sliding will take play in Yanqing, about 55 miles from Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 高山滑雪和雪橇將在延慶舉辦，距離北京約55英里。

sentences.english: Dog drivers have a long history of using crossbreeds as sled dogs as well.
sentences.chinese: 雜交狗和雪橇犬被用來拉車已經有很長的歷史了。

sentences.english: Instead of carrying the children on their backs, the dogs are pulling them on a sled.
sentences.chinese: 這些狗並非讓孩童騎在背上，而是用雪橇來拉他們。

sentences.english: Conrad has a sled, but he does not slide in it.
sentences.chinese: 康拉德有一個雪橇，但是他沒有滑雪橇。

sentences.english: Conrad has a sled, but he does not slide in it.
sentences.chinese: 康拉德有一個雪橇，但是他沒有滑雪橇。

definition: Père David's deer (Elaphurus davidianus), species of deer native to China that is critically endangered
